channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-14213] Ensure ASF policy compliant headers and correct LICENSE and NOTICE files in artifacts for 0.94
item.description: From tail of thread on HBASE-14085, opening a backport ticket for 0.94. Took the liberty of assigning to Sean Busbey.
item.summary: Ensure ASF policy compliant headers and correct LICENSE and NOTICE files in artifacts for 0.94

status.description: This issue was once resolved, but the resolution was deemed incorrect. From here issues are either marked assigned or resolved.

comments.comment: 0.94 is EOL'd. We're doing final release, no more versions after that.

if we're going to do another release, then we need to make sure it complies with ASF licensing policy.

I have a WIP of this in a local repo. I'll find some time this week to check on its status.
Thanks Sean Busbey. Anything I can do to help? (I was ready to do the release today, when I saw this issue reopened)

oof. wish I had checked up on jira notifications before I spent last night on precommit improvements.

I'll grab the WIP tonight and try to describe what's lacking. presuming it's more than I can finish in a couple of hours, it will probably be faster for someone else to take over finishing it.
Thanks Sean Busbey!

Also... Can I/we manually make a good faith best-effort to update the LICENSE/NOTICE file? Since this is the last release, it does not need to be automated.
I think a good faith effort should be good as far as Apache goes.

0.94 has close 900 files that still include the copyright header.
I think I can automate most with mix of find, grep, and sed.

The LICENSE/NOTICE file I should be able to just copy from 0.98.
-part1: clean all Java and XML files
-part2 ruby and Makefile
-part3 shell scripts
-part4: protobuf
-part5: all the rest. Other files and what the scripts missed.
Accidentally added my helper scripts to the patches, but that rest should be OK.
combined patch that fixes all headers

LICENSE and NOTICE (copied from 0.98, don't think we changed dependencies)

Sean Busbey, stack, is that enough good faith to ship the last 0.94 release?

Here's the patches as they were for 0.94 LICENSE/NOTICE/headers.

Includes a backport of HBASE-14199.

This successfully creates our artifacts. I haven't reviewed if everything gets covered by the generated LICENSE/NOTICE files. Doing that shouldn't take any more work than generating the files manually.
IIRC, there were dependency differences between 0.98 and 0.94.

Awesome. Thanks Sean Busbey. I owe you a coffee next time you're around!
I only had to add a license to hadoop-metrics.properties (was flagged by rat)

Looked at the generated tarballs, looks all good. Going to commit and spin a release!

Thanks again.

Committed to 0.94.

Thanks again. Sean Busbey

Sean Busbey, will this still do what you intended with the addendum patch?

doesn't look like it.

  • the LEGAL file has to be included to meet our requirements for including Jruby. It shows up in the patch I posted. Maybe something went wrong with applying it?
  • the supplemental-model file is needed to correctly generate the convenience binary LICENSE/NOTICE file. again, shows up in the patch.
  • the shade plugin is just in pluginManagement, so including the change shouldn't matter unless something else is invoking it. I don't remember enough context if something else did, so I'm not sure what removing it from pluginManagement will do.

any objection to me removing the profiles for versions that are either missing or marked X in the support matrix?

Yeah, need to update the book. 1.0.4 is in fact the default for 0.94.

The 0.94 version of book has the following listed as supported (http://hbase.apache.org/0.94/book.html#d1984e486):
1.0.x, 1.1.x, 0.23.x, and 2.x

I think everything else we can remove.
